input_text:
Job Title: Chief Traffic Engineer

Location: Tampa, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Design, Engineering

Description:
EELEMENT Engineering Group is currently seeking a Chief Traffic Engineer with Florida Department of Transportation experience. This individual will serve as a leader within the Traffic Group and be responsible for project management, development of traffic design plans, quality control reviews, marketing pursuits, and mentorship of junior staff. ELEMENT’s support of the Department and local agencies across the state facilitates exciting opportunities for innovation, problem solving, and multimodal-focused designs that serve to better our communities.
ELEMENT offers a competitive benefits package including the potential for yearly bonuses, ongoing training and development, and flexible work arrangements. We also offer 100% company sponsored medical, short- and long-term disability, and basic life insurance. Employees are vested in our 401K upon hire, and we provide 3% to every individual, regardless of whether they are able to contribute. 
Through building a learning community where you can work with diverse individuals, explore new ways of thinking, and expand your capabilities, you can reach your fullest potential and make a significant impact on a growing organization. ELEMENT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. 
At ELEMENT, we are well respected in the communities we live, serve, and play in. We are an award-winning consulting firm that has devoted itself to the engineering needs of public-sector clients in the development of infrastructure since our founding in 2006. ELEMENT’s design services include roadway, drainage, traffic control, signing & pavement markings, signals, lighting, structures, utilities, and traffic studies. ELEMENT also provides survey, subsurface utility engineering (SUE), and utility coordination to round-out all aspects of transportation engineering. The streamlined ability to meet our clients’ needs as a full-service firm brings ELEMENT employees a unique opportunity to be exposed to all aspects of a project’s life. Required Duties and ResponsibilitiesLead Traffic Engineering Team by directing traffic team resources with a focus on quality; train, mentor, and direct younger staff; leading internal training programs; support and lead recruiting efforts and actively participate in industry events. Serve as project manager and/or technical professional and maintain responsible charge over traffic design/engineering tasksPerform quality control reviews and lead quality control efforts for the Traffic Group.Assist and/or lead marketing efforts for the Traffic Group related to traffic design, operations, and/or studies. Marketing pursuits will be catered to the development and growth of ELEMENT and the Traffic Group and split between support of design project pursuits and targeted prime pursuits. Marketing efforts will also include supporting relationship development for subconsultant and priming opportunities. Focus on leading team to win an FDOT traffic design and/or studies contract as a prime.Produce lighting, ITS, signing and pavement marking, and signal plans in accordance with FDOT and local agency standards.Engineering analysis and design using current best practices with a focus on Vision Zero principles and the Safe System approach.Support strategy planning related to new traffic-related service lines and growth of ELEMENT.Conduct field reviews for project design and construction. Effectively communicate and coordinate with other members of the design team and across disciplines.Meet with clients and attend public meetings, as necessary.Maintain professional engineering registration.
Required Qualifications
Professional Engineer registered in Florida with 10 to 20 years of post-registration experience Bachelor’s degree in Civil EngineeringTraffic design expertise including signals, ITS, and lightingKnowledge with the current Florida Department of Transportation Manuals such as FDOT Design Manual, Florida Standard Plans, the Traffic Engineering Manual, Manual on Uniform Traffic Studies, and Florida Greenbook in addition to the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices. Excellent technical, written, and oral communication skillsStrong working knowledge of MicroStation, experience with ORD is a plus.Legally authorized to work in the United States.
Preferred Qualifications
FDOT Advanced Maintenance of Traffic CertificationFDOT Specifications TrainingFamiliarity with AutoCAD

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
